content.question: Let <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function given by <math alttext="f of x, equals x squared, times the natural log of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.1em"></mspace><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></math> for <math alttext="x greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></math>. On which of the following intervals is the graph of <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> concave down?

choices.label: <math alttext="0 comma e raised to the negative three halves power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn><mo largeop="true">/</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></msup></mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="2.4ex" width="0.0em"></mspace><mo>)</mo></mrow></math> only

<math alttext="0 comma e raised to the negative one half power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mo largeop="true">/</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></msup></mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="2.4ex" width="0.0em"></mspace><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="e raised to the negative three halves power comma infinity" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn><mo largeop="true">/</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></msup><mo>,</mo><mi>∞</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="2.4ex" width="0.0em"></mspace><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="e raised to the negative one half power comma infinity" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mo largeop="true">/</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></msup><mo>,</mo><mi>∞</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="2.4ex" width="0.0em"></mspace><mo>)</mo></mrow></math> only

content.answer: <math alttext="0 comma e raised to the negative three halves power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn><mo largeop="true">/</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></msup></mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="2.4ex" width="0.0em"></mspace><mo>)</mo></mrow></math> only

topic.text: 5.6: Determining Concavity of Functions over Their Domains

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
